sen.j: 京都市交通局（きょうとしこうつうきょく）は、京都府京都市内及びその周辺地域で公営交通事業を行う京都市の地方公営企業の一つである。
sen.e: Kyoto City Transportation Bureau is one of the local public enterprises engaged in public transportation services in Kyoto City and its vicinities.
Kyoto City Transportation Bureau is one of the local public enterprises engaged in public transportation services in Kyoto City and its vicinity.
The Kyoto City Transportation Bureau is a local public enterprise engaged in the provision of public transportation services in Kyoto City and its vicinity.
sen.cmt: This reads a little more smoothly, I think.

sen.j: 地下鉄（京都市営地下鉄）、路線バス（京都市営バス）を運営している。
sen.e: It operates subway services (Kyoto Municipal Subways/Kyoto City Subway) and local bus services.
sen.cmt: http://www.city.kyoto.jp/koho/eng/access/transport.html路線図には"Kyoto City Subway Line"と表記
sen.e: It operates subway services (Kyoto Municipal Subways/Kyoto City Subway) and local bus services.
It operates subway lines (Kyoto Municipal Subways/Kyoto City Subway) and local bus routes (Kyoto City Bus).

sen.j: かつては市電（京都市電）・トロリーバス（京都市営トロリーバス）も運営していた。
sen.e: Once it operated Kyoto Municipal Streetcar (京都市電) and Kyoto City Trolleybus.
It was once the operator of Kyoto Municipal Streetcar (京都市電) and Kyoto City Trolleybus.
It was once the operator of the Kyoto Municipal Streetcar (京都市電) and the Kyoto City Trolleybus.

sen.j: スルッとKANSAIでカードに印字される符号は入場記録用は京交で、降車記録用がKCである。
sen.e: The entrance record printed on KANSAI THRU PASS is Kyoko (京交), and the exit record is KC.
The entrance record printed on KANSAI THRU PASS is "Kyoto (京交)," and the exit record is "KC."
When using the KANSAI THRU PASS, "Kyoko" (京交) is printed on the card when you enter a station or get on a bus, while "KC" is printed on it when you exit a station or get off a bus.
sen.cmt: While I can guess the meaning, I don't think this would be completely clear to a native speaker of English. Also, please note that "京交" would be written in romaji as "Kyoko" note "Kyoto".

sen.j: 事業
sen.e: Services
Services
Services

sen.j: 京都市営地下鉄（2路線 31.2km）
sen.e: Kyoto City Subway (2 lines, 31.2 km)
Kyoto City Subway (two lines, 31.2 km)
Kyoto City Subway (two lines, 31.2 km)

sen.j: 京都市営バス
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus
Kyoto City Bus

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 各事業の詳細な歴史は、京都市営地下鉄、京都市営バス、京都市電、京都市営トロリーバスの各項目を参照。
sen.e: Refer to "Kyoto City Subway", "Kyoto City Bus), "Kyoto Municipal Street Car", and "Kyoto City Trolleybus" for detailed history of each service.
Refer to "Kyoto City Subway," "Kyoto City Bus)," "Kyoto Municipal Street Car" and "Kyoto City Trolleybus" for a detailed history of each service.
Refer to "Kyoto City Subway," "Kyoto City Bus," "Kyoto Municipal Street Car" and "Kyoto City Trolleybus" for a detailed history of each service.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）2月1日 京都電気鉄道が、日本初の路面電車を塩小路東洞院下ル（現在の京都駅前付近）～伏見下油掛間で開業させる。
sen.e: February 1, 1895: Inauguration of Japan's first street car service by Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道) between Shiokoji-Higashinotoin Kudaru (present-day areas in front of Kyoto station) and Shimo-aburakake-cho

The inauguration of Japan's first streetcar service by Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道) between Shiokoji-Higashinotoin Kudaru (the present-day areas in front of Kyoto Station) and Shimo-aburakake-cho was held on February 1, 1885.

February 1, 1895: The inauguration of Japan's first streetcar service by Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道) between Shiokoji-Higashinotoin Kudaru (the present-day areas in front of Kyoto Station) and Shimo-aburakake-cho Fushimi was held.
sen.cmt: 年号間違え訳を補いました。

sen.j: 1912年（明治45年）6月11日 京都市電気軌道事務所が市電烏丸線、千本・大宮線、四条線、丸太町線を開業。
sen.e: June 11, 1912: Inauguration of Street car service by Kyoto City Electric Tramway (京都市電気軌道事務所); Karasuma Line, Senbon and Omiya Line, Shijo Line, and Marutamachi Station
The inauguration of streetcar service by Kyoto City Electric Tramway (京都市電気軌道事務所); Karasuma Line, the Senbon and Omiya Line, the Shijo Line and Marutamachi Station was held on June 11, 1912.
June 11, 1912: The inauguration of streetcar service by Kyoto City Electric Tramway (京都市電気軌道事務所); Karasuma Line, the Senbon and Omiya Line, the Shijo Line and Marutamachi Station was held.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）7月1日 京都市が京都電気鉄道を買収。
sen.e: July 1, 1913: Purchase of Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道) by Kyoto City
The Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道) was purchased by Kyoto City on July 1, 1913.
July 1, 1918: The Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道) was purchased by Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1920年（大正9年）7月7日 京都市電気部に改組。
sen.e: July 7, 1020: Reorganization into Electric Department, Kyoto City
The reorganization into the Electric Department, Kyoto City, took effect on July 7, 1920.
July 7, 1920: The reorganization into the Electric Department, Kyoto City, was implemented.
sen.cmt: I don't think the use of "take effect" here would strike a native speaker of English as particularly strange, but I have complied with the client's request for passive.年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1924年（大正13年）4月15日 京都市電気局に改組。
sen.e: April 15, 1924: Reorganization into Electric Department, Kyoto City
The reorganization into the Electric Department, Kyoto City, took effect on April 15, 1924.
April 15, 1924: The reorganization into the Electric Department, Kyoto City, was implemented.
sen.cmt: I don't think the use of "take effect" here would strike a native speaker of English as particularly strange, but I have complied with the client's request for passive.年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）5月10日 市営バス運行開始。
sen.e: May 10, 1928: Start of City Bus service
The City Bus service started on May 10, 1928.
May 10, 1928: The City Bus service started.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1932年（昭和7年）4月1日 トロリーバス運行開始。
sen.e: April 1, 1932: Start of trolleybus service
The trolleybus service started on April 1, 1932.
April 1, 1932: The trolleybus service started.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1947年（昭和22年）12月17日 京都市交通局に改組。
sen.e: December 17, 1947: Reorganization into Kyoto City Transportation Bureau
The reorganization into the Kyoto City Transportation Bureau took effect on December 17, 1947.
December 17, 1947: The reorganization into the Kyoto City Transportation Bureau was implemented.
sen.cmt: I don't think the use of "take effect" here would strike a native speaker of English as particularly strange, but I have complied with the client's request for passive.年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1969年（昭和44年）10月1日 トロリーバス廃止。
sen.e: October 1, 1969: Abolition of trolleybus service
The trolleybus service was abolished on October 1, 1969.
October 1, 1969: The trolleybus service was abolished.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1978年（昭和53年）10月1日 市電全廃。
sen.e: October 1, 1978: Total abolition of city street car service
The city streetcar service was fully abolished on October 1, 1978.
October 1, 1978: The city streetcar service was fully abolished.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1981年（昭和56年）5月29日 京都市営地下鉄烏丸線開業。
sen.e: May 29, 1981: Opening of Kyoto City Subway, the Karasuma Line
The Kyoto City Subway, Karasuma Line, opened on May 29, 1981.
May 29, 1981: The Kyoto City Subway, Karasuma Line, opened.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1983年（昭和58年）3月15日 「京都観光一日乗車券」が発売開始。
sen.e: March 15, 1983: Introduction of Kyoto Sightseeing One and Two-day Pass Card
The Kyoto Sightseeing One- and Two-Day Pass cards were introduced on March 15, 1983.
March 15, 1983: The Kyoto Sightseeing One Day Pass card was introduced.
sen.cmt: 現在のサイトを見て1日、2日乗車券を採用したようですが、原文に忠実に一日乗車券としました。年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1993年（平成5年）7月1日 プリペイドカード「トラフィカ京カード」が発売開始。
sen.e: July 1, 1993: Introduction of a prepaid card called Traffic Kyoto Card
The Traffic Kyoto Card prepaid card was introduced on July 1, 1993.
July 1, 1993: The Traffic Kyoto Card prepaid card was introduced.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）10月12日 京都市営地下鉄東西線開業。
sen.e: October 12, 1997: Opening of Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway Line
The Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway Line, opened on October 12, 1997.
October 12, 1997: The Tozai Line, Kyoto City Subway Line, opened.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）3月1日 共通乗車カードシステム「スルッとKANSAI」に加入。
sen.e: March 1, 2000: Participation in the common pre-paid card system KANSAI THRU PASS
Participation in the KANSAI THRU PASS common prepaid card system went into effect on March 1, 2000.
March 1, 2000: Participation in the KANSAI THRU PASS common prepaid card system went into effect.
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 「スルッとKANSAI都カード」発売。
sen.e: Introduction of KANSAI THRU PASS Miyako Card
Introduction of KANSAI THRU PASS Miyako Card
Introduction of KANSAI THRU PASS Miyako Card

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 地下鉄路線でICカード「PiTaPa」を導入（乗り入れしている近畿日本鉄道、京阪電気鉄道大津線も同時導入）。
sen.e: April 1, 2007: Introduction of IC card "PiTaPa" for the subway lines (concurrent with Kintetsu Corporation/Kintetsu Railways and Keihan Otsu Line, which share reciprocal connection service)

April 1, 2007 marked the introduction of the IC card "PiTaPa" for the subway lines (concurrent with Kintetsu Corporation/Kintetsu Railways and Keihan Otsu Line, which share reciprocal connection services).

April 1, 2007: Marked the introduction of the IC card "PiTaPa" for the subway lines (concurrent with Kintetsu Corporation/Kintetsu Railways and Keihan Otsu Line, which share reciprocal connection services).
sen.cmt: 年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 大阪メトロサービスとの提携カードである「京都ぷらすOSAKA PiTaPa」を発行。
sen.e: April 1, 2007: Introduction of Kyoto and Osaka PiTaPa, under an credit card affiliate program with Osaka Metro Service
April 1, 2007 was the introduction date of Kyoto and Osaka PiTaPa, under a credit-card affiliate program with Osaka Metro Service.
April 1, 2007 was the introduction date of Kyoto and Osaka PiTaPa, under a credit-card affiliate program with Osaka Metro Service.

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）3月31日 京都市交通局本庁舎が、中京区壬生から右京区の太秦天神川「サンサ右京」に移転。
sen.e: March 31, 2008: Transfer of Headquarters from Mibu, Nakagyo Ward to SANSA Ukyo, Uzumasa-tennjinngawa, Ukyo Ward
The transfer of headquarters from Mibu, Nakagyo Ward to SANSA Ukyo, Uzumasa-tennjinngawa, Ukyo Ward, took effect on May 31, 2008.
May 31, 2008: The transfer of Headquarters from Mibu, Nakagyo Ward to SANSA Ukyo, Uzumasa-tennjinngawa, Ukyo Ward, was performed.
sen.cmt: I don't think the use of "take effect" here would strike a native speaker of English as particularly strange, but I have complied with the client's request for passive.年表形式に表記を統一

sen.j: 社名に「京都」を冠する路線バス事業者の京阪京都交通（旧・京都交通 (亀岡)）、京都交通 (舞鶴)、京都バスとは、人材・資本の関係が一切ない。
sen.e: Private local bus operators, Keihan Kyoto Bus (former Kyoto Kotsu (Kameyama Station) and Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru), have no capital and personnel relations with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.
Private local bus operators, Keihan Kyoto Bus (formerly Kyoto Kotsu (Kameyama Station) and Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru), have no capital or personnel relationship with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.

The private local bus operators Keihan Kyoto Kotsu (formerly Kyoto Kotsu (Kameoka Station), Kyoto Kotsu (Maizuru) and Kyoto Bus have no capital or personnel relationship with Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau.
sen.cmt: 訳を補いました。名称間違え

sen.j: 京都市交通局の労働組合は京都交通労働組合（日本都市交通労働組合に加盟）である。
sen.e: The labor union of Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau is Kyoto Kotsu Labor Unions. (a member of All Japan Municipal Transport Workers' Union)
sen.cmt: http://www.toshiko.or.jp/京都交通労働組合については定訳不明
sen.e: The labor union of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau is Kyoto Kotsu Labor Unions (a member of the All Japan Municipal Transport Workers' Union).
The labor union of the Kyoto Municipal Transportation Bureau is Kyoto Kotsu Labor Unions (a member of the All Japan Municipal Transport Workers' Union).

sen.j: 京都バスの労働組合は京都バス労働組合、京阪京都交通の労働組合は京阪京バス労働組合（ともに日本私鉄労働組合総連合会に加盟）である。
sen.e: The labor union of Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd is Kyoto Bus Labor Union, and the labor union of Keihan Kyoto Kotsu is Keihan Kyoto Bus Labor Union. (both of which are members of General Federation of Private Railway Workers Unions of Japan)
sen.cmt: http://www.kyotobus.jp/京都バス労働組合,京阪京バス労働組合については定訳不明http://www.pru.or.jp/
sen.e: The labor union of Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd., is the Kyoto Bus Labor Union, and the labor union of Keihan Kyoto Kotsu is the Keihan Kyoto Bus Labor Union (both of which are members of the General Federation of Private Railway Workers Unions of Japan).

The labor union of Kyoto Bus Co., Ltd., is the Kyoto Bus Labor Union, and the labor union of Keihan Kyoto Kotsu is the Keihan Kyoto Bus Labor Union (both of which are members of the General Federation of Private Railway and Bus Workers' Union Japan).
sen.cmt: スペース削除用語をリストに合わせる

sen.j: 発車メロディ関連では鉄道事業者で唯一、著作権を有している。
sen.e: Kyoto City Transportation Bureau is only the Japanese transportation enterprise that holds the copyright to its departure melodies.
The Kyoto City Transportation Bureau is the only Japanese transportation enterprise that holds the copyright to its departure melodies.
The Kyoto City Transportation Bureau is the only Japanese transportation enterprise that holds the copyright to its departure melodies.

sen.j: 2007年に京都市幽霊バス問題が発覚。
sen.e: In 2007, one of its bus line was found to be in service without an approval of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism
sen.cmt: 内容から訳出しました
sen.e: In 2007, one of its bus lines was found to be in service without an approval of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism.
In 2007, one of its bus lines was found to be in service without an approval of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism.

sen.j: 公共広告機構の2007年度地域キャンペーン「天ぷら油で走る」のコマーシャルメッセージに京都市バスが登場した。
sen.e: One Kyoto City bus appeared in a local campaign film in 2007 fiscal year, which was made by Japan Ad Council with a message saying, "It runs on waste tempura oil."
One Kyoto City bus appeared in a local campaign film during the 2007 fiscal year, which was produced by the Japan Ad Council with a message saying, "It runs on waste tempura oil."
One Kyoto City bus appeared in a local campaign film during the 2007 fiscal year, which was produced by the Japan Ad Council with a message saying, "It runs on waste tempura oil."

sen.j: CMの内容は、1997年に発表された京都議定書に基づき、地球温暖化防止のために軽油に代わる燃料として食用油の廃油で作ったバイオディーゼル燃料を使用し、市バスやゴミ収集車に使用しているというもの。
sen.e: The commercial film says that bio-diesel fuel made from waste vegitable oil is usd for City buses and garbage trucks as a substitue for light oil in their activities for preventing global warming advocated by Kyoto Protocol in 1997.

The commercial film says that bio-diesel fuel made from waste vegitable oil is usd for city buses and garbage trucks as a substitue for light oil in their activities, as a means for the prevention of global warming as advocated by the Kyoto Protocol of 1997.

The commercial film says that bio-diesel fuel made from waste vegetable oil is used for city buses and garbage trucks as a substitute for light oil in their activities, as a means for the prevention of global warming as advocated by the Kyoto Protocol of 1997.

sen.j: このCMはAC大阪事務局が企画し、主に関西ローカル（一部全国）で放送されている。
sen.e: This commercial films designed by Osaka Bureau, Japan Ad Council is being aired mainly on Kansai local TV (partially nationwide)
This commercial film, produced by the Japan Ad Council's Osaka Bureau, aired mainly on Kansai local TV (partially nationwide).
This commercial film, produced by the Japan Ad Council's Osaka Bureau, aired mainly on Kansai local TV (partially nationwide).
